descendants.content:
@breadandcircuses

This death cult. Make them stop. Please, someone, everyone, make them stop.

Imagine you're on a spaceship, and somebody is taking a chainsaw to the life support systems while people stand around. Because that is what is happening.

account.note:
🌏 Born at 312 PPM

Retired NGO executive doing my best to stay informed and raise awareness about environmental crises, climate breakdown, and the rapacious, murderous impact of greedy capitalists and the politicians they own.

Why the name? Back in the day, empires placated their citizens with "bread and circuses." Now we get fast food and apps. But it's all basically the same — distraction from what's REALLY happening.

fields.name: See my Toots
fields.value: https://justmytoots.com/@breadandcircuses@climatejustice.social

fields.name: Favorite saying
fields.value: "Be kind to everyone you meet, for they are fighting a great battle.”

descendants.content:
@breadandcircuses @violetmadder

we've got to win the next election. it's the most important election. don't worry about the climate, gaza, women's rights, workers rights, voter rights, none of it matters, all that matters is that our candidate wins the next election.

then we can talk about saving humanity. but wait, there's another election right around the corner, we better coalesce around our candidates and don't ask them tough questions or expect too much or they will lose the next election.

descendants.content:
@breadandcircuses @violetmadder OFC noone questions that...

  • Keeping the wetlands as they are is essential!

I was merely thinking about the reason to building a harbour and dredging are being logistics, and that this is avoidable with a railroad which will result in the least possible disturbance of the ecosystem once installed...

Even if we'd make it like 2+2 tracks to enshure redundancy and optimal useability at peak load that would still be less of a hassle than a two-ane highway with proper dredging and signposting and adjacent infrastructure like truck stops and so forth...

But all the mentioned mass export goods would already be easier to transport reliably and at lower cost with less maintenance by rail - heck even if it's merely a combined system and switches had to be done manually by train personnel it would be better...

descendants.content: @kkarhan As the article says, most of that soy, sugar, corn, cement, iron, and manganese is being exported from the Global South to North America, Europe, and Asia. This is economic and climate colonialism. The Global North *must* reduce demand, i.e. #degrowth.

descendants.content:
@breadandcircuses There is just no water in Rio Paraguay. It has 0,35 m in Ladáio, where it should have 4,08 m! And dredge would make it even worse!

A waterway without water?

https://www.acritica.net/editorias/meio-ambiente/rio-paraguai-podera-enfrentar-seca-historica-alertam-especialistas/757494/

account.note:
Seit 2017 lebe ich mit meiner neuen Familie in Manaus und dem Hinterland am #Amazonas. Deshalb beschäftige ich mich besonders mit allem, was hier in der Region und in #Brasilien passiert. #Indigene, #Klima und #Umweltschutz liegen mir dabei besonders am Herzen. Seit neuestem interessiere ich mich auch für die präcabralinische Geschichte und Archäologie am Amazonas.
Beruflich: digitale Weiterbildung, #Inklusion, #Integration, #Bildung und Pädagogik.
